articleinfo.title: The Linux Documentation Project Weekly News

listitem.para: David S. Lawyer cleaned out the Plug-and-Play HOWTO. v1.08 presents more clarity in the explanations, corrections of obsolete statements and an intro on hot pluggable devices and USB.
v1.0.3 of the openMosix HOWTO by Kris Buytaert has minor corrections.
The guys and girls from traduc.org finished translating the Hardware HOWTO into French.

The Introduction to Linux Guide v1.14, by Machtelt Garrels, has an extended chapter about I/O redirection and more about Linux groups and related commands. Apart from the new topics, it also contains minor corrections and an updated glossary.

Jean-Philippe Guérard let us know that members of the Traduc.org team will be attending the 5th Libre Software Meeting from 6 to 10 July. He also hopes that this will be an occasion to tighten the relationship with TLDP and to replace the dead fr.tldp.org project with Traduc, the currently official French translation effort.
This is like the baby-boom, but with Linux now. The whole of Texas is appearantly running Linux now, and Canada is on their heels:
: set up by Eduardo Valdes in Toronto, Canada;
: Johnny Hughes is the maintainer for this mirror in Corpus Christi, Texas;
: also in Texas, in Dallas, by Timothy Folks.

sect1.title: HOWTO contribute to The LDP
sect1.para: The Linux Documentation Project (TLDP) is working on developing free, high quality documentation for the GNU/Linux operating system. If you want to help TLDP, consider joining discuss-subscribe@en.tldp.org.

Help us create this newsletter. We need volunteers who follow the community (mailing lists, newsgroups, web channels) and report events related to free software documentation. Write to us at feedback@en.tldp.org.
The LDP Weekly News is compiled and edited by Machtelt Garrels and Y Giridhar Appaji Nag with help from several other people.
